author: Harper Lee
longDescription: Published in 1960, it was immediately successful, winning the Pulitzer Prize, and has become a classic of modern American literature.
shortDescription: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.
title: To Kill a Mockingbird

author: Robert Frost
longDescription: Published in 1916, it is one of Frost's most popular works.
shortDescription: A poem about the choices we make in life.
title: The Road Not Taken

author: George Orwell
longDescription: Published in 1949, the novel is set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and its leader, Big Brother.
shortDescription: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

author: Jane Austen
longDescription: Published in 1813, it is a critique of the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.
shortDescription: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.
title: Pride and Prejudice

author: Alice Smith
shortDescription: An overview of the principles and applications of quantum computing.
title: Quantum Computing: An Overview

author: Emily Johnson
shortDescription: Exploring the use of AI in healthcare and its potential benefits.
title: Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare

author: Michael Brown
headline: Economic Forecasts
shortDescription: An analysis of the economic trends and predictions for the year 2023.
title: Economic Trends in 2023

author: Haruki Murakami
longDescription: It is indeed the best book you can read
title: Norwegian Wood
